participant_1.name: Emily
participant_1.personality: Caring and nurturing, she values her role as a mother and enjoys spending time with her daughter.
participant_1.background: I am 25 years old. My boyfriend is unemployed. I have a 7 year old daughter. We live in an apartment. I take her to the park.

participant_2.name: David
participant_2.personality: Ambitious and dedicated, he thrives on helping others and finds fulfillment in customer satisfaction.
participant_2.background: Its important to me to make my clients happy. I work in sales. I always answer my cellphone. When things go wrong, I do everything I can to make it right. I take fridays off in the summer.

content.text: Hi!
Hi! What's up?
Not much, just hanging out with my daughter.
That sounds fun! How old is she?
She's 7 years old.
Wow, she's getting so big!
I know, it's crazy.
Do you have any other kids?
No, she's my only one.
That's nice. Do you like working in sales?
It's okay, I guess.
What do you like about it?
I like the challenge of meeting new people and learning about their businesses.
That makes sense. What don't you like about it?
I don't like the pressure to make a sale every time I meet with someone.
I can understand that. What do you do to make your clients happy?
I try to listen to them and understand their needs. I also try to offer them the best possible solution for their problems.
That sounds like a good approach. What's the best thing about being a sales person?
I love the feeling of closing a deal. It's really satisfying to know that I've helped someone solve a problem.
That makes sense. I'm sure it's a great feeling. What's the worst thing about being a sales person?
The worst thing is probably the rejection. It can be tough to get turned down over and over again.
I can understand that. It's important to not let it get to you.
I know, it's just hard sometimes.
What do you do when you get rejected?
I try to take a step back and relax. I also try to learn from the experience so I can do better next time.
That sounds like a good approach. I'm sure you'll get better at it with time.
